name: Premier Inn London Blackfriars (Fleet Street)

reviews.text: We stayed two nights and had dinner bed and breakfast. The Hotel and our room were immaculate. The hotel was very busy being Easter weekend, but wow we were very impressed and will definitely be back. In a really quiet area, but stones throw from black friars tube and a short walk to aldwych theatres. Staff at the thyme restaurant couldn't do more, they were polite and efficient and very accommodating of our needs. The food was plentiful in portion size and very tasty.
reviews.title: Super clean and brilliant service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay. A lovely hotel, thank you to the helpful and courteous staff, see you again soon.
reviews.title: Great location, great service!

reviews.text: This hotel offers clean surroundings, quality service and excellent location! The hotel has provided above and beyond by way of service and cleanliness. The attached restaurant is convenient and offers a solid breakfast to get your day started. The rooms are a bit small but we are here to see sights and the bed is comfortable. The staff are informative and quick to assist you with directions and options. The location is superb- central London and within easy walking distance of the Tube and several venues. I definitely recommend London Blackfriars!
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here yesterday and just waiting for my taxi. Just thought i would give the hotel some feedback. The rooms are very clean and well decorated. The staff are friendly and approachable. No room service which is fine with me but some might find it a handicap. Very nice breakfast! Amazing coffeee!!!! I had three within half hour. Will visit soon.
reviews.title: Central location good for both tourist and business travellers

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights mid-week. Good value for central London. Helpful check-in staff, comfortable no-frills rooms, spotlessly clean & working air-conditioning. Windows don't open, so this could be a problem if you like fresh air. Very quiet location off New Bridge Street, close to Blackfriars Station & bus stops. Only 5 mins walk to St Pauls Cathedral & City of London. Restaurant staff very pleasant and evening menu reasonably priced, esp if you have the 3 course evening meal deal with breakfast. Wonderful wide selection available at breakfast. Free internet for 30 mins per day worked well. We would not hesitate to go back as it's the best hotel we've found in the area.
reviews.title: A good choice for a little further out of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bit late for review especially as i have visited london twice since then but I must tell about this brilliant premier inn,.Me and hubby stayed december 2012 when christmas festivities were in full swing, situated just off fleet street very easy to find, and one straight road from the Strand. Staff were well mannered,professional and so friendly you would think it was a 5 star,, usual brilliant night sleep in a spotless clean room.Couldnt find fault. Another good point it the proximity to the river thames and the brilliant pubs close by...The 'blackfriar 'by the station is warm and welcoming..'.the olde Cheshire cheese 'is a must if you like tradition...further along the Old bailey and the famous 'George' pub..we had a brilliant time and got a bargain price...unfortunately this PI has almost doubled in price since we stayed ...but it will be amongst my favourite places to stay in london.
reviews.title: cant beat it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You certainly have an excellent hotel. the staff were like old friends and nothing was too much trouble.We stayed for 3 nights and eat an excellent breakfast every day (no need for Lunch). The rooms are of an excellent standard very clean and warm. The closeness of Blackfriars tube staion is a definate plus. We visited the CHARD well worth a visit. When we come to London again We will certainly stay at your hotel.
reviews.title: great location and super staff

reviews.text: Stayed at Blackfriars Premier Inn for a shopping trip to London. The hotel is new and looks grand from the outside. The reception is small but functional. I prefer spacious lobbies in hotels but I can't complain as the staff here are genuinely helpful & willing to help. This is rare in London. We selected this hotel purely as the tripadvisor rating was good, and I say they should be in the top 10.
reviews.title: Nice pad for my shopping trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kids loved the food here especially the breakfast. The underground is just across the road but I would rather recommend the buses at Fleet Street which get you through the heart of london's west end in minutes. A taxi to the west end was less than 10 pounds. Only downside is they don't have a carpark, and the nearest one is 10 mins walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent service all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Premier Inn's are fairly standard in their appearance these days and its upto the staff to make them stand out. From the moment I arrived for my overnight stay, I couldn't have felt more welcome. There were 2 staff to check me in and both were very friendly and efficient and seemed to genuinly want my stay to be as good as it could be.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: The main reason for the choice of this hotel was the combination of price and the locality. The locality half way between the City and Westminster made it the first choice. When it comes to the rest, all I can say is that it was all right. The rooms are generally small. The toilet was f. ex. placed in such a way that everytime someone else wanted to open the door, one had to move legs aside or wear a kneepads for protection. There was no socket in the bathroom for shaving. Go figure why? On the contrary, there was a make-up mirror in the cupboard/wardrobe section with the socket, but the mess is impossible to clean on a wall-to-wall carpet when there is no hoover. The shower head was fixed to the waterpipe being that as high as 150 cm above the bathtub, it created a big mess outside(!) the bathtub, and I never used it again. Another thing is the noise being carried under the doors. There was NO sound isolation to the corridor, so no privacy. You could hear with ease the whole conversation of people disaggreeing or having fun inside. The mattresses were a bit hard, so I was actually aching in my back and shoulders every day, which is NOT good. The air-condition is probably programmed to saty at max. 21 degrees Celsius, because when we wanted to warm a room bit more, it stopped after two minutes and went down to 21 again. Mind you, we were in London when it was really chilly, with temperatures under 0 every day, so we really needed the temperature up. That leads me to the warm water issue. Both my son and I have couple times tried the warm water from watertap to the sink, without getting it ever really warm. The caution sign of HOT water seemed a bit redundant there.The only place when the water got warm was when we filled the tub.
reviews.title: You get the basics...

reviews.text: Then, a positive feature: they charge 10 pounds a week (or 3 pounds a day) for the WiFi, which is all right, and one can have up to three devices connected to one account.
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over to breakfast. The first day, I was nicely surprised by the presentation of all the choices we had when it comes to breakfast - eggs prepared in five ways, the porridge etc., but because we were staying for the whole week, it got pretty predictable. The was no cheese, no ham, only yogurt with flavor, small jams and honey and butter. Then there was croissants, small muffins, and two sorts of bread. I simply ended up thinking that, yes, I get the stomach filled, but that's just about it. I actually dread now when I retrieve it from my memory of it.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was as polite and as helpful as the English manner can be, but it has to do with the design of the hotel and the policy the hotel franchise is running. I would not come back, and I'm writing it well knowing that we will return to London again, of course. I'm sure that people who stay for couple of days, it's just a great hotel, but for longer stay, it's not good.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.text: Just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. We have previously stayed at the Premier Inn Southwark. Blackfriars much better value - very easy access to tube, breakfast far nicer although family room smaller. Staff at Blackfriars are exceptional - polite, very friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was cold ( very cold weather ) & the staff offered a heater which was provided within 5 mins of the suggestion. Evening meal good quality and great price . Will definitely stay here again. I
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: We stayed here as a party of four over two nights. It is in a great location and great value for money. We did not book breakfast but decided to have it on the first morning at short notice and although it was pretty busy it was well handled by the staff the only complaint was they decided to place a large family group behind me which meant every time anybody went to get past I got a knock in the back but the breakfast was excellent value but it seemed to be sit as many people as quickly as possible. We ate both evenings in the restaurant and that was yet again it was great value for money the pancake parcels are gorgeous. They do great value meals and I would suggest you consider these options.
reviews.title: Would come again

reviews.text: The other couple with us on both evenings had to go to reception and get their card key authorised to gain entry to their room which when on the 5th floor is a bit of a pain.
reviews.title: Family Weekend Break

reviews.text: In conclusion excellent staff and I would visit again.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: I am in Essex next month and I have booked another Premier Inn as they are value for money.
reviews.title: memorable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value for a family room in this location. Friendly staff, attentive and polite. Great with the kids. Fantastic breakfast and good value child friendly meals in the hotel restaurant. Well Done - would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: great value for money

aka: Premier Inn London Blackfriars (Fleet Street) England
